1.3
Renewal
This agreement will be automatically renewed at the end of every ten (10) year term, with each subsequent term of renewal being for a ten

perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for termination from six months to one month may violate the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, which exists in contract law in many jurisdictions, including England (the governing law of this agreement). A one-month notice may be deemed unreasonably short, especially considering the ten-year term and the investments made by both parties. This short notice period potentially causes significant harm and disrupts the business relationship, contradicting the principle of providing reasonable notice for contract termination.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under English contract law.

perturbation.original_text:
5.3
Rejection of defective products
The Customer shall inspect all Products promptly upon receipt thereof and may reject any defective Product, provided that the Customer
shall within seven (7) days after receipt of such alleged defective Product, notify the Manufacturer of its rejection and either:
(i)
request to destroy in field for credit of the value of the defective product and the associated shipping costs (with approval), or
(ii)
request a Return Material Authorization (“RMA”) number and within seven (7) days of receipt of the RMA number from the
Manufacturer return such rejected Product to the Manufacturer.
Products not rejected within the foregoing time periods shall be deemed accepted by the Customer.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.3
Rejection of defective products
The Customer shall inspect all Products promptly upon receipt thereof and may reject any defective Product, provided that the Customer
shall within two (2) days after receipt of such alleged defective Product, notify the Manufacturer of its rejection and either:
(i)
request to destroy in field for credit of the value of the defective product and the associated shipping costs (with approval), or
(ii)
request a Return Material Authorization (“RMA”) number and within two (2) days of receipt of the RMA number from the
Manufacturer return such rejected Product to the Manufacturer.
Products not rejected within the foregoing time periods shall be deemed accepted by the Customer.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the rejection notification period from seven days to two days is unreasonable and potentially violates the principle of providing a reasonable opportunity to inspect goods, implied in contract law and potentially covered under the Sale of Goods Act (if applicable under English law, given the international nature of the agreement). Two days may not be sufficient for a thorough inspection, especially for complex products or large shipments. This unreasonable constraint can lead to unfair acceptance of defective products, contradicting fair business practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied terms regarding reasonable opportunity for inspection under the Sale of Goods Act (potentially applicable under English law) and general principles of fair dealing.

7.2
Rectification of Breach
Where the breach is rectifiable, the breaching party has 21 days from the date of notification of its breach to rectify. Following the expiry of
this period, the non-breaching party may execute any rights it may have both in law and under this agreement.

Rectification of Breach

perturbation.explanation: Reducing the timeframe to rectify a breach from 21 days to 7 days might be deemed unreasonable, especially for complex breaches requiring significant investigation or corrective action. Such a short period could conflict with legal principles requiring a fair opportunity to cure a breach, potentially leading to premature termination and related legal challenges. Although the agreement specifies 'rectifiable' breaches, the shortened timeframe does not adequately account for scenarios where a 7-day period is insufficient to genuinely address the issue, conflicting with the implied duty of good faith.
